--- title: Data Screening description: Visualización y análisis estadístico del feature dataset authors: Ian Contreras --- ## Importaciones ### Librerías ::: {#importing-libraries .cell execution_count=1} ``` {} #| label: importing-libraries # Manejo de datos y análisis import numpy as np import pandas as pd import scipy.stats as stats # Modelos estadísticos y econométricos import statsmodels.api as sm from statsmodels.graphics.tsaplots import plot_acf, plot_pacf from statsmodels.tsa.stattools import adfuller from pmdarima.arima import auto_arima from arch import arch_model # Visualización import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # Presentación en IPython from IPython.display import Markdown, HTML ``` ::: :::{#aefef7b4 .cell .markdown} ### Data ::: ::: {#importing-data .cell execution_count=2} ``` {} #| label: importing-data df = pd.read_csv(r'..\data\csv\irp.csv', parse_dates=[ 'date'], index_col='date') # df = pd.read_csv(r'.\data\csv\irp.csv', parse_dates=[ # 'date'], index_col='date') returns = df['price_return'] split_date = '2020-12-31' R_test = df[df.index >= split_date]['price_return'].rolling( window=5).std().dropna() ``` ::: :::{#b0a373ee .cell .markdown} ## Análisis Exploratorio. ### Serie Histórica ::: ::: {#cell-fig-price-return-series .cell execution_count=3} ``` {} #| label: fig-price-return-series #| fig-cap: Serie de retornos diarios IRP-GOBIX. fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 10)) ax.plot(df.index, df['price_return']) ax.set_ylabel('Retorno Precio (BPS)') ax.set_xlim([df.index.min(), df.index.max()]) ax.legend() plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` No artists with labels found to put in legend. Note that artists whose label start with an underscore are ignored when legend() is called with no argument. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Serie de retornos diarios IRP-GOBIX.](data-screening_files/figure-ipynb/fig-price-return-series-output-2.png){#fig-price-return-series} ::: ::: :::{#cba08b2c .cell .markdown} ### Análisis descriptivo de la muestra ::: ::: {#tbl-return-descriptive-stats .cell execution_count=4} ``` {} #| label: tbl-return-descriptive-stats #| output: asis #| fig-cap: Tabla de las estadísticas descriptiva de la serie de retornos desc_stats = returns.describe() skewness = returns.skew() kurtosis = returns.kurtosis() jb_test = sm.stats.jarque_bera(returns) descriptive_table = pd.DataFrame({ 'Observations': [int(desc_stats['count'])], 'Mean': [desc_stats['mean']], 'Median': [desc_stats['50%']], 'Std. Dev': [desc_stats['std']], 'Skewness': [skewness], 'Kurtosis': [kurtosis], 'Jarque-Bera': [jb_test[0]], 'Prob.': [jb_test[1]] }) Markdown(descriptive_table.to_markdown(index=False)) ``` | Observations | Mean | Median | Std. plt.hist(returns, bins=50, density=True, alpha=0.6, label='Resultados Empíricos') for dist in distributions: params = dist.fit(returns) x = np.linspace(returns.min(), returns.max(), 100) plt.plot(x, dist.pdf(x, *params), label=f'{dist.name} fit') plt.xlabel('Retorno Precio (BPS)') plt.ylabel('Verosimilitud') plt.legend() plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Ajuste de predicted) / actual_std)) * 100 mape_value = MAPE(R_test, forecasted_std) print(f"MAPE on Test Set (based on moving std): {mape_value:.2f}%") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` MAPE on Test Set (based on moving std): 739.70% ``` ::: ::: :::{#185a4d92 .cell .markdown} ### Predichos vs Actuales Plot-Backtested ::: ::: {#cell-fig-predicted-vs-actual-backtest .cell execution_count=17} ``` {} #| label: fig-predicted-vs-actual-backtest #| fig-cap: Desviación Estándar Móvil Real vs Pronosticada -
